sample.title: Text steganography with letter marking (binary mode)
sample.summary: Hide and extract a message in and from another text
sample.description: This is a text steganography technique where the bits of a secret message is hidden by marking the letters of the message in the cover text.
sample.title: Text Steganographie mit Zeichenmarkierung (binärer Modus)
sample.summary: Geheime Nachrichten in einem Text verstecken und wieder extrahieren
sample.description: Das ist eine Text Steganographie Technik, wo die Bits einer geheimen Nachricht in einem Text versteckt wird indem die Buchstaben der geheimen Nachricht im Cover Text entsprechend markiert werden.

replacement.value: He ordered his regular breakfast. Two eggs sunnyside up, hash browns, and two strips of bacon. He continued to look at the menu wondering if this would be the day he added something new. This was also part of the routine. A few seconds of hesitation to see if something else would be added to the order before demuring and saying that would be all. It was the same exact meal that he had ordered every day for the past two years.

Dieser Modus der Textsteganographie konvertiert die geheime Nachricht in Bits und setzt eine Markierung unter oder über die Buchstaben im Covertext, wo das Bit 1 am gleichen Index im Bitstring ist oder nichts hinzufügt, wenn das Bit an diesem Index 0 ist. Also um die gesamte Nachricht zu verstecken, sollte die Anzahl der Buchstaben im Covertext gleich oder größer als die Anzahl der Bits in der geheimen Nachricht sein.

He ordered his regular breakfast. Two eggs sunnyside up, hash browns, and two strips of bacon. He continued to look at the menu wondering if this would be the day he added something new. This was also part of the routine. A few seconds of hesitation to see if something else would be added to the order before demuring and saying that would be all. It was the same exact meal that he had ordered every day for the past two years.

This mode of text steganography converts the secret message to bits and puts a mark under or above the letters in the cover text where the bit is 1 at the same index in the bitstring or does not add anything when the bit is 0 at that index. Therefore, to hide all of the message correctly, the number of letters in the cover text should be equal to or greater than the number of bits in the secret message.
